BNC User Reference Guide

<setting>

setting (setting) describes one particular setting in which a language interaction takes place.
Class att.uniqueId att.ascribed
Declaration 
element setting
{
   attribute n { text }?,
   att.uniqueId.attribute.xmlid,
   att.ascribed.attribute.who,
   ( date | model.settingPart )*
}
Attributes
(In addition to global attributes and those inherited from [att.uniqueId att.ascribed ] )
n an internal identifier for a setting.
Status: Optional
Example
 <setting n="090910" who="PS1YR PS1YS"
xmlns:xaira="http://www.xaira.org/ns/1.0/spec"
xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
xmlns:rng="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0">
  <placeName>Strathclyde: Glasgow </placeName>
  <locale> doctor's surgery </locale>
  <activity> medical consultation </activity>
 </setting>
Note

If the who attribute is not supplied, the setting is assumed to be that of all participants in the language interaction.
Module corpus
